title: Exclusive Jenson Button interview: My secret battle with anxiety
text:
It was during the Chinese Grand Prix in 2004, as Shanghai’s sequence of four high-speed corners took the air right out of his chest, that Jenson Button first started to worry about himself.

So extreme were the G-forces, he came close to a panic attack in the car. “It was such a weird feeling,” he says. “The engineer kept telling me to breathe and I thought: ‘I can’t.’”

To the outside world, Button has always projected a mask of invulnerability. Throughout his 309 races in Formula One, the fourth most by any driver in the sport’s history, Button was a study in smoothness, a man who defied his early caricatures as a playboy to become a world champion and whose answer to any sign of trouble was...
description: It was during the Chinese Grand Prix in 2004, as Shanghai’s sequence of four high-speed corners took the air right out of his chest, that Jenson Button first started to worry about himself.
